author: Liamoog
title: Wow for Location and Wow for Staff
text:
Following the satnav carefully as it goes along the small streets of South London got us to the hotel. It has a few parking spaces (4 I think) one of which was marked for wheelchair use. The hotel is L shaped and is attached to The Anchor pub.
Its location does mean that there are some changes in elevation within the building, but for wheel chair use that was not a problem.
Its facilities are as you would expect from this price range hotel. In the room, room 4, there were tea making facilities, room temperature control worked very well. A large comfortable double bed.
The bathroom was accessible with grab rails around the toilet. It had a bath but it too had a good deal of hand rails making it accessible tor those with reduced mobility.
The room and all the building was clean and well presented.
As it stands the building would rate a 3-4 star.
Breakfast was in The Anchor pub. The journey is along a series of corradors. If you are in a wheelchair you may need a had with the between floors lift as the door is heavy. There was hot and cold food and it was topped when needed, even at a busy time.
And now for the first Wow factor - location. It is a very short walk from Borough Market and the Golden Hind. It is an even shorter walk from the river Themes and a short stroll to Tate Modern and the Rose theater.
And the second Wow factor - the staff. From checking in, to departure, the team at the front desk were superb. It makes such a difference to have local people with local knowledge. It make a very real difference when they are friendly, professional and yes, for a hotel in London, very hospitable. So a personal 'Thank You' to Rina, Jomilsa and Julie. They turned a good quality budget price hotel into something special. We are looking forward to finding an excuse to return.
